meanings.definition: To remove or take off by scraping.
meanings.sent1: She scraped the paint off the wall with a scraper.
meanings.sent2: I scraped the mud off my shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent3: He scraped the burnt toast, trying to salvage it for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The detective scraped the surface of the case, uncovering new evidence.
meanings.sent5: The chef scraped the burnt bits from the pan, revealing a shiny surface.

meanings.definition: To rub or scrape (a surface) in order to clean or smooth it.
meanings.sent1: Mom scraped the dishes clean before putting them in the dishwasher.
meanings.sent2: The janitor scraped the gum off the classroom floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat scraped its claws on the scratching post, sharpening them for hunting.
meanings.sent4: The gardener scraped the soil to prepare it for planting.
meanings.sent5: The artist scraped the canvas to create texture in the painting.

meanings.definition: To barely manage to achieve or accomplish something.
meanings.sent1: She scraped through the exam with just enough correct answers.
meanings.sent2: He scraped by with the minimum required effort.
meanings.sent3: The team scraped a win in the final seconds of the game.
meanings.sent4: The student scraped a passing grade in the challenging course.
meanings.sent5: The company scraped together enough funds to stay afloat for another month.
